job_title: Software Development Engineer (SDE) II in Bangalore
pros:
- Work-Life balance is great
- Free Lunch

- Encourages Innovation and Entrepreneurship if you are up for it

- Few team members from India (Principal Engineers, Team Leads) are amazingly talented

- Passionate offshore colleagues willing to lend a hand and discuss ideas
cons:
- Many Indian teams (DES and ML specifically) are full of self-proclaimed software engineering experts without having exposure to building high-quality software. Managers are the worst.

- Many Indian teams worship the offshore teams and lack the skillset to perform basic tasks, propose new ideas, or follow through with them

- This has led to a feeling of superiority-complex among the offshore team treating Indian team members as 'Tech-support only' folks.

pros:
Positive culture and environment

cons: World HDQ in Munich Germany

pros: Flexible working time and lunch vouchers.
cons:
--- Management a bit manipulative, with biased description of the job, misleading new hires. 

--- No complexity in digital design (very very simple stuff), meaning no chance of patents and innovations. But hey, someone has to do it even if is simple, so I get it. But is just  not a magnet for talents (in certain departments of Graz at least).

--- No free snacks as advised. But that would not solve the following issues.

--- Very political and a bit weird environment: head managers and former designers of one field (like Digital) becomes Analog directors and viceversa, just because of vacancies. Matters how you move, not what you know. Might be a good philosophy for some people, might not be for others.

--- Some managers are spotted to travel to Munich every week just for getting the travel bonus and doing no real job. This waste money and management does not take actions. I don't know why.

--- Very high process culture kills creativity. 

--- Many senior digital engineers only because of years of experience and not necessarily knowledge (not all of course, but this methodology promotes also lazy people). If you are good, you become senior in 3 years, if you are not good but enough to keep the job, you become senior in 3 years.

--- Career opportunities are not there, if you are a digital designer (you might become senior, and finishes there, the job will be the same for the next 10 years, no patents, no conferences, is just not needed).

review_title: Don't rock the boat and you will be fine.
pros: Great products and technology. Opportunity to travel domestically as well as internationally to Germany and Austria. Big time customers to support and visit from time to time. Some departments you will not be expected to work much at all, others next door to you will require more effort. Depends on your manager and department. Very hard to get fired, that is perhaps a con as many folks come to milk off the niceness of the company.
cons: You will never be able to be autonomous from the German rule. Do not try to have an independent idea and if you do, you better have an ally at HQ to support your idea and a plan. Support is limited from Germany and is not timely but their expectations of you are quite different. America's culture in Milpitas location is very poor, and upper management is disconnected with middle management and could care less about your aspirations to climb that ladder. Also, incompetent managers thrive alongside the hardworking managers and the pay will be the same so where is the incentive to try harder?

review_title: ATV department work culture is too bad and loads of useless work
pros:
Views are for the ATV department:
Policies of the company are good like free lunches. Re-imbursement of food if staying late. Employees can go by Taxi like Ola/Uber if worked late till night like beyond 9 PM.
cons:
This is very specific to ATV dept.:
- Loads of politics. Some old timers(5 yrs and beyond, not many are there) will not work. They only have advisory work/business and it is because of their decision making that the entire department suffers.
- It is actually a 7 day working company. During releases you will not be spared and end up working on Sats and Suns(pretty normal).
- Managers(CoCs) do not care about the employees they only care about the deadlines. People are treated like cattle.
- Not much to learn except the process part. Actual Automotives technical work is purely absent. They work only on the MCAL layer.
- Germans in the ATV deptt. regard themselves as superior(which is pretty obvious) and they will be decision makers. Bangalore is just follower. 
- Totally thankless company, you work your brains out and nobody bothers. Credit will go to the people who did not even work but only gave advises. You do 1000 things right, one thing wrong, you will be screwed and treated like junk.
- Gender discrimination(females are given preferrence over males). Males are not spared any mistakes. Females are treated as queens, even though they do not have any knowledge or are fresher just out of college.

job_title: Senior Staff Engineer in Munich, Bavaria
pros:
- exciting technologies
- Infineon is the technology leader in a couple of market segments which could be the basis for a sustainable profitable company
- and will probably evolve as a good company to work for once it's current trouble blow over
cons:
- the organizational setup of the company is an unlimited source of frustration
- IFX managament is constantly a victim to it's own lies
- Infineon has terrible corporate governance (it's supervisory board is controlled by SIEMENS which obviously does not have a clear idea how to setup a profitable compay 
- Infineon's way of management tends to ignore reality and is mostly surprised when they ultimately have to face it
- the best CEO IFX ever had was recently ousted (W.Ziebart)
- working for IFX is like banging your head against the wall  24/7
- Infineon's technical ladder system is completely degraded and absolutely demotivating
(in reality it creates 2nd class employees, which can be pushed around by whomever is not part of the technical ladder). There is no system in place which makes sure that grades on the technical ladder are awarded based on merits. It is rather driven by politics and proximity to the headquarter

review_title: Please make the wrongs right instead of maintaining the wrongs
pros:
1. Good office environment
2. Stable company, no layoff when economy turns bad, no lay off when employees are not performing, too
3. Strong technology leadership but limited to EU sites 
4. Less demanding compared to others companies that I am working/worked for (in SG)
5. Good work life balance
6. Above average pay compared to others companies in northern Malaysia
cons:
1. Hiring strategies is very poor, or maybe no strategies at all. Hiring doesn’t focus on the skills needed, attitude and characters.
2. Engineers are lack of knowledge and skills, both technical and non technical, maybe due to No. 1. 
3. Traditional style promotion, promotion often comes when the time comes. Not good when not qualified engineers becomes senior/staff then managers. 
4. Lack of technical independence even as a manufacturing sites, often rely on EU sites support.
5. No proper/structured trainings from HR and also department for new hires.

pros: The location of the company is convenient.
cons: The salary is not competitive.

review_title: Great IT Opps for people based in their Central Munich Office
pros: Their IT roadmap and solutions are amazing.. Really good in house systems, eagerness to embrace new tech and some very bright people.
cons: If you don't speak German then you are left out of meetings where you are not the lead or directly required to action an item. English is meant to be the corporate language, but this doesn’t appear to be the case for IT, as they freely talk German in meetings and on calls and only occasionally translate the odd subject when they think you will need to work on it. Your opportunities for progression are non-existent if not based in Munich or Villach and the relocation package offered is nowhere near enough, if you have small children in education. If you don't fall into the above cats, then i would guess this could be a really good company to work for.

review_title: A place to start your career....but don't stick around too long.
pros:
Friendly environment, most people are quite supportive and helpful.
Good opportunities for traveling between sites either on training or workshops.
Good starting point if you are interested in semiconductor industry
cons:
Poor benefit and health package. HR has no clue what employees want or how to retain people.
Long working hours, even on week ends with no recognition or appreciation from management.
"Pass the buck' attitude between various departments and sites.
Management rarely has a clue on their strategies, often end up being market followers rather than leaders.
High employment turn-over rate.Salary increment not in line with job responsibilities / position. 
Poor promotion opportunities, complicated promotion assessments methods.
Poor communication between various sites, lack of info sharing, current implemented policies to promote knowledge exchange is severely deficient.
Runs like one big dysfunctional family  without a clear future.

pros: Company tends to play it (sometimes overly) safe when it comes to innovation and process change.  I list this as a pro- though... Company seems to know where it is going and the path to get there, making small measurable progressive steps to target and not getting distracted by quick wins.   Very stable.   No BIG wins - but no BIG losses either.   Not easily distracted by butterflies.   New CFO for IFAM positive improvement.
cons: Can seem to be a bit bureaucratic and over-engineered at times, but I would say typical of any large business.   Can be seen as resistant to change.

pros: They just throw u into the sea and let u learn how to swim by yourself without guiding. At the same time you can learn but tough at the beginning.
cons: Not suitable for fresh graduate to enter. Lack of guiding. The management direction always change and waste a lot of time for you to learn and gain. The bosses there are really bad tempered and bit friendly at all. If can dun enter M1.

review_title: The best place I have worked
pros:
Infineon has talented people with down to earth attitudes.  Everyone in the company is approachable, especially senior management.  The company has a strong team ethic, devoted to high quality and innovation.  It is surprising how supportive and respectful they are. Their style is partnering not parenting.

The company is financially secure and virtually debt free.  Their salary structure appears to be competitive.  The best perk is the paid bonus/ incentive plan which is based on company performance.  It has been paid out at over 100% for the last 10 years.  This is unusal. 
 
They work at attracting and fostering talent.  Employees stay a long time.  Many employees are in the 10 -15 year range.
cons: More access to training from mid management and below

review_title: Very satisfied, happy to work in this company
pros: Friendly environment, good share and gain of knowledge, respect and support from all the levels of the hierarchy, fair potential for personal growth. The company is literally at the edge of the technology and gives you a lot of opportunities to learn and become successful in the fields you want. A continuously growing company, continuously changing based on the flow.
cons: Lack of motivation, if you are not self - motivated then nobody will push you to the correct direction for your personal growth. You have to do it by yourself. The fact that the company is in a leading position of the technology, sometimes, leads to a stressful environment. Not all colleagues are qualified to work that fast or under stress or willing to work a bit harder.

pros: Reputable company to work for within semiconductor/electronics industry.  You will feel good that you are part of something that change the world.   Innovative products developed by bright engineers.  Good learning opportunities for those who are starting out in career.
cons: Lack of vertical movement in career advancement.  Short of opportunities for seasoned professionals.  Managers/directors still manages with old school mentality; "Do your job and be content with all that is offered to you, no need to worry about advancements".  Slow decision making processes and is driven primarily by politics and who you work with.

review_title: Troubled HR department makes for poor work atmosphere

pros: The best parts about working at infineon are probably the amount of time off emplyees get. However this applies to a lot of companies in germany and austria as well. Tons of paid vacation and a pretty flexible schedule allow for a lot of personal freedoms other companies may not offer.
cons: Poor managment, too many managers, too few options for career opportunities, poor grading system by HR. HR is probably my biggest complaint, since they seem to do so little for their employees. Even if it's not the case, they are not making it look any different. This leads to a lot of unhappy employees.

pros:
Benefits so far so good...
people are good as long as you never poked their back or go against their will...
career advancement are consider ok...
cons:
politics here and there, till the management also play the same game...
Bias on the vendors selection, not healthy for the overall organizations...
the HR hiring policies never side the internal people for internal transfer, they always think the outsider are better and hired with better package...
reorganization is normal here, almost every 2 years big and 1/2 year small, but it always disappoint the people as the organization changed never really focus on the problem... just for the sake of change only...

pros: Infineon is a stable, profitable and well managed company. They are a technology leader in the Power Management, Automotive and Security semi-conductor industry. Compensation and bonus's are good, work conditions are reasonable and the organization is thoughtful regarding the relationship with employees. The successful acquisition and integration of International Rectifier is evidence of the quality of the Infineon leadership and structure.
cons: Infineon is a global company with head quarters in Germany, so the top down standardization in policy, organizational controls and limitations on career opportunity is a factor for those who want to want to "lead the pack" or need maximum creativity 360 degrees..

review_title: Great and underestimated german high-tech company
pros: Infineon, former Siemens Semiconductors, is one of the few genuine german high-tech enterprises. It offers jobs for highly motivated engineers in a very modern environment and is represented in may countries around the globe, which offers great opportunities for inter-cultural collaboration. Automotive and chipcard business units are doing quite well, being market leaders in various segments.
cons: After separation of Qimonda (the memory business, which went bankrupt) and Lantiq (wireline communications) and the transfer of the wireless business to Intel, there is only little left from a formerly big enterprise, which is kind of sad. In some (getting less) areas there are remainders of typical german "we never done it that way" (aka not invented here syndrom) - killing innovation ideas rather brutally.

review_title: Great Environment, Wonderful Colleagues and Terrible Managers/Team Leaders
pros:
- Good benefits (depending on your location and type of contract )
- Healthy and positive work environment
- Great team spirit
- Excellent Work/Life Balance
cons:
- Management is usually very incompetent and has no interpersonal skills whatsoever. This is mostly due to the fact they are usually promoted on the basis of seniority and not merit or skill. 

- Even if you go the extra mile to achieve all your targets and get involved in different projects and initiatives, don't expect your Team Leader to praise you or to give you any recognition for your efforts.  The lack of encouragement and support is extremely disheartening.

In short, If you're looking for a company that values its employees and your work, better look elsewhere.

job_title: Senior Staff Engineer in Milpitas, CA
pros: Good benefit package, still matches 401K plan, descent salaries, stable environment. Company still has Siemens mentality, management cares about people. Global management was able to perform restructuring during global crisis.
cons: people handle multiple projects, although management cares about people there are many too complicated rules and regulations  reducing  motivation. System of incentives does not influence motivation of every particular person. A person can not drastically influence his own pay,  it does not depend on his skills and hard work.

job_title: Supplier Master Data Trainee in Porto, Oporto
pros:
Good benefits, as working from home in certain circumstances. Good for working students as they provide leaves to perform exams and it doesn't have influence on your salary (except for meal allowance, of course). 
Great office space, with relaxing and play areas. Started to get too crowded for lunch.
cons: Poor management style. Lack of decisions making. Everything was theoretical and in practice the management errors are never assumed and all the blame is always on the employees of lower level. Some managers showed to much respect towards certain employees.

review_title: Still a good place to work
pros:
Still a good place to work, respectful management, not bad navigation through tough economy. Knowledgeable staff, good chance to educate yourself working with industry leading experts. Company is an industry leader in some application areas.  Restructuring helped company to remain an industry leader, stay on the cutting edge of technology.
Still good benefits in tough economy times. Flexible time off,
cons: After cutting costs people got assigned to multiple projects, too much paperwork, sometimes that paperwork takes more time and looks more important than actual work. People getting nervous, some are leaving the company (usually the best experts). Chances to get training reduced with budget cuts.

review_title: Watch-out... compensation should not be the only criterion for a good work place
pros: Infineon has a very good compensation package. There is some flexibility about your working hours. Because of its location (ITPL), it takes time to reach here but the shuttle service is very good and comfortable. ITPL also has lot of banks and bill-pay facilities. So it is hassle-free to get anything done.
cons: PLease be informend that I am commenting only about Bangalore office and more so my particular group. Bangalore office is very dependent on the HQ for direction. In addition, If you were planning to do some creative work, you can forget about it. Quality of the employees is not very high either.

pros: Descent salary. Free Non veg lunch.
cons:
Every exit door within the building has swipe out access. Even to go to reception area we need to swipe out even though its official duty and this time is minused from 9 hrs thats mandatory to stay in office. Feels like we are locked in a 10storied building. Swipe out even to breathe fresh air outside for two minutes

No breakfast.  Even if you want to pay and buy, no stalls available. Only a small kiosk that sells maggi

pros:
Work language is english (german between german colleagues)
Great work environment
Very warm and welcoming people
Excellent, modern infrastructure
Personally had problems with the IT but that was a one time thing
No extra time demanded (I was just a student worker)
Good salary for the position
Learned a lot, made contacts, an excellent experience
cons:
A lot of time wasted in useless meetings and telephone contacts
Open office structure makes it hard to focus sometimes (people on the phone, talking...)
Not much space to grow within the company
Be ready to prove your worth
Be ready to be placed in locations like Malasya
Some unexplained decisions from the management
A few full-time workers (not students) expressed some weariness at their jobs and the company
Too much bureaucracy for even the simplest things

review_title: Family Atmosphere but Dominated by Munich
pros: Great people in the Americas.  Fun atmosphere.  Acquired International Rectifier, trying to be more nimble in the US and globally.  Large revenue base globally with very diversified and stable business.
cons: Very large infrastructure with strict process orientation.  This leads to slow deliberate decision making and permanent commitments.  Infineon is slow to react to new market opportunities and seems to be stuck as a market follower.

job_title: Mixed Signal Design Engineer in Villach
pros: The relaxed environment and flexible working hours. Normally you don't need to worry about schedules (if you are in R&D). As long as you achieve your goals and deadlines, you're pretty much free to handle your own time as you see fit. Villach is a beautiful location and perfect for outdoor activities. Summer is great.
cons: If you don't speak german (and even if you do) you're gonna have a hard time to connect with the locals. Austrian people in general is very cold. They are respectful, but not friendly. Villach is a very small town in the middle of the Alps with not much to do if you're into city life.

pros:
- Only the good relocation treatment but after that HR get very negative attitude toward you.
- Good for new graduate, only for 1 year, in order to get a good name on the CV and leave soon.
cons:
- Mentality of people. Everybody looks mistrustful on your ideas and improvements. 
- German is basically a must, if not you are pratically excluded from the team or not considered as one of them.
- Non good place for improving technically, you´ll do always same stuff or all the garbage left by the seniors so all the most boring tasks.

pros:
- Excellent Environment.
- Management with international mindset.
- Cross matrix working environment meaning that managers taking care of project (columns) and managers taking care of the people (rows).
- Supportive HR team.
cons: - HR team does not inform OR help foreign employees to apply for tax reduction which is 30% and a lot of people already missed this because you have to apply to the tax reduction within 6 months after the arrival to Austria.

pros: Infineon Technologies is a Very Good Company for freshers, It will give lot of opportunity and time to grow. Adequate Work Life Balance, Management believes training the employees plays a major role Human resource creation, it provides number of training's for freshers and  Experience people, Technical and Non Technical Events  will be organized very frequently.
cons: Over all Very slow in decision taking process and Also depends on Changes in  Local Management, Very Frequent Changes in Local Management

pros: Good work life balance depending on your manager. Salary is average. Depending on your division you can work with some amazing people.
cons: Upper management not the brightest. Working for a German company has many levels of be procedures and fluffy company slogans to preach. Propaganda. Besides this nonsense it's a good company. Being in America is not truly corporate America. You are a yes man to the HQ but if you are an average achiever you will do well

pros: Flexibility work, great international team, smart bosses, nice atmosphere of work, good salary, very good employee support, opportunity to change place of work inside of company, free coffee, everywhere is clean, possibility to take a weekend in any time.
cons: For growing to the next position is need a long time (3+ year minimum). A promotion depend from years of working, but not directly from your skills and knowledge. Of course knowledge is important, but without years of working here - it's nearly impossible. Maybe, I'm wrong. But it is what I see.

review_title: Six Month Review in Americas Region
pros: Well managed with sound understanding of where they are in the market, where they want to be, and what it takes to get them there.  Vision communicated readily to everyone.  Fellow employees are cordial and helpful.  Good work atmosphere.
cons: Expect long hours at onset.  You're going to be hired to get a job done with typically not a lot of structure beforehand.  Lots of room to develop and grow.  Budgets are seemingly always under review and constraint, so speed on execution is not as effective as it could be.

pros: Very laid back, no work pressure, seems to have some processes in place
cons: Seems to allow managers to change mind on people immediately on having someone join. I was hired in the  central corporate function and the interview was hasty, I was told to come on my own expense. Just 2 months on joining I was told to find another position within the company or leave in 6 months. No compensation for having shifted countries to take up the offer. The HR was totally absent in the whole procedure and seems to have no power at all. As I learnt, a hasty hiring decision was made expecting a hiring freeze, but then later when there there turned out to be no hiring freeze, the manager wanted to bring in a more suitable candidate by background.

pros: May be you get more money if you negotiate it well. Out door activities like team outings.
cons: repetitive and monotonous work for the contract & external employee. Externals are hired for testing work. Externals don't get opportunity to learn because exposure and information are hidden from them. Most internal employees have no respect for the externals as human. Lot of blame game. They hire very highly experienced senior people as externals, and then give them work worth a 2 year experienced guy. That will ruin your career. The management and HR differentiates between the externals and internals in public.. I think thats the root cause of this culture.

review_title: Great chance for motivated young engineers to enter into an exotic field in Romania - IC Design
pros: As an engineer you have flexible time, as long as you deliver good quality and in time. Your proffesional development depends only on how motivated you are, once this is visible you get full support from managers.
cons: Although inevitable in any company, too often you see too much politics... Another unpleasent downside, especially for star performers, you don't have bonuses based on project performance, but only an annual bonus based more on the overall company results; in some cases this type of reward is not motivating at all, and descourage performance oriented mindset.

pros:
Company Culture:
* Not too small a site, not too big. You can get to know people without getting sick of each other. 
* Leads and supervisors in the fab are very approachable. Everyone working in the cleanroom is very eager to teach/encourage newbies. 
* Nice break room: flat screen tvs, free-to-use coffee machine (lattes, mochas, etc.), lemonade, and tea. Vending machines with healthier options. 

Benefits:
* 401K Matching up to 4.5% of yearly take home.
* 10 paid holidays a year (do not need to work).
* About 4 PTO hours earned every two work weeks for new employees. Better for folks who have been there longer. 

Schedule:
* Condensed work schedule means 3-4 days off in a row. 
* When my sup or lead asks folks if they can cover an unexpected absence, they are very understanding. No arm pulling. Just a "hey, if you are available, we need help". 
* Three breaks over 12.5 hour day:
     - paid 30 min break in morning
     - unpaid 30-45 min lunch
     - paid 30 min break in afternoon

Opportunity for Growth:
* If you want to learn more, and you are committed, you will be supported. Management is receptive to ideas for improvement. 
* Company pays employees for ideas that save money, streamline processes, and reduces opportunity for error, called YIP: Your Idea Pays.
cons:
Specific to Company:
* Pay is quite low for the industry. Start at $14/hr.
* Night shift only earns a 10% differential (20% is standard)
* Mandatory overtime is assigned at random. One day per month. 
* The work instructions and OCAPs need to be seriously updated. 
* The 'certification' quizzes and tests are, likewise, very outdated. 

Specific to Industry:
* Expect to work holidays. Barring a spectacular year (in terms of company income) the plant rarely shuts down.

pros: Good place to work. Flexible time. Business is good and stable.
cons: Work-life balance depends on department where you are. There are departments that are really great and so, "great place to work" is really true. But if you, for any reason lost to the unfortunate department, well, take it as a lesson and experience that worth to remember for a life time.

pros: Since it is my first company I do not have any reference point to compare my job with some other experience.  But it is good for the experience of how several processes and plans gets execute for a project, good for learning the basics and interfacing of hardware and software as well as working of the software while considering safety in vehicle.
cons: Sometimes it is too much work pressure and ego problems between colleagues.

pros: Put lots of effort to make a great work place. Good learning place for fresh to 3 years engineers. A lot of things to learn even for experienced person
cons: Way too much politics & a lot of Taichi masters (pushing responsibilities to others). Succession usually based upon how well you are connected to upper management and upper management keeps a very close knitted/elite circle.

pros: Good salary, financially best positioned company in semiconductor, active in all key drivers of today's economy, excellent colleagues, fantastic campus
cons: Have to understand and develop a passion for semiconductors, among only three European semiconductor companies - so a silicon-valley style atmosphere not available; this also means that switching jobs is less fluid and tends to remain within the electronics industry

job_title: Analog RF Engineer in Bucharest, Bucuresti

cons:
very often you are required to work extra time to be able to finish in time for tape out
promotion and salary increase is not as motivating as it should be

cons: No work from home, not much interaction with the customers, few domains in the company is very narrow/limited, Bangalore zone has lack of confidence compared to the teams in Germany, not well known to the common people, career growth is slow

pros:
Very helpful team members.

review_title: Stable technology corporation with not motivating culture
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros:
Highly technological corporation with industry leading product portfolios that “runs by engineers” not by fancy-school MBA “stock exchange slaves”.  Good for learning analog semiconductors. Good benefits. Very stable corporation and employment.
Infineon invests heavy into the best and newest manufacturing equipment and automation.
Top corporate governance did well through great recession, re-focused, and makes right decisions.
cons:
No upward mobility and motivating factors. 
Corporate culture is cold and impersonal, no team building, does not feel “like family”.
Heavy on paperwork to the point of absurd. One paper covers another in cycles. Personal responsibility and signature is not valued. Decision risk is always spread by forced collegiate process as result you rarely can get things done your way. 
Overall company is penny-pinching when it comes to employee. Personal sacrifices for company are not rewarded.

Motivation from management is on the level of “be happy you have a job” and “we think we pay you well”.
Corporation spends ton of money on agitation. Walls are covered with typical eye-sore posters.

If you are next Steve Jobs forget about Infineon. This company is not for you. Infineon likes quiet executant doers. 
All top management always appointed and sent from Germany, therefore mid management has nowhere to grow, as result whole corporate structure is stagnant. There is absolutely no upward mobility. It’s zero. I have not seen promotions. Open positions filled from outside. By joining Infineon, you put your carrier on brake.
Corporate philosophy is like that: if you happy where you are you can retire from here, if you are not happy – go. I’ve seen many good professionals leaving company for that reason.

It’s the most discouraged, diminished, and the least rewarding job I had for long time. 
There are couple of unprofessional, abusive, threatening, yelling, disrespectful managers that make work environment a hell, but HR and upper management do nothing about it.

Compensation
You work for a salary and annual bonus. Bonus varies every year and can be quite high.  Compensation and bonus structure changes time to time. Most times bonus is not depending from your personal performance. 
Performance evaluation is once a year at the end of corporate fiscal year. Pay raises are mediocre, delayed, and not regular. 

Benefits
There is no profit sharing, stock options, RSU, or any similar incentive benefits.
What stands out is vacation time. Infineon encourages use of PTO. To schedule straight 3-4 weeks off is not an issue.
Infineon has generous 401K plan with company matching and retention vesting.
Medical insurance coverage and options are good, but cost for employee more than double and keep rising every year.  It got costly. 
Company matches dependent care account and gives one week for maternity/paternity/burial leave.
During my time, I have seen many perks been eliminated without replacement.

For Longtimers
Infineon sold a division with few hundred employees without offering a severance package option. Absolutely nothing.

Sometimes I think that Infineon looks OK only because competition is even worse.

review_title: Nice balance between life and work
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Munich, Bavaria
pros: Work load in most cases are low. Nice working environment, most of colleagues are nice. Working hours are flexible and home office is an option. Also that means you've got more time to catch up with new technology trend.
cons: Management politics is heavy.Also it's common that IT managers do not know IT. So if you are really a software developer, your development skill will not make you a beautiful carer here. Also quite a few IT staff are not so competent from my point of view.

job_title: Head of the Department, Central R&D in Bangalore

review_title: The company provides good development opportunities to employee especially fresh graduate. For that, I am grateful.

pros: I worked with an awesome team!  All were very dedicated and truly enjoyed worked with one another.

review_title: Infineon Technologies, NA: good and needs improvement

Just honest, hardworking good management.  That's hard! I'm impressed.  I think I'll stay a while.

review_title: Unequalities for salary, job grades, work assignements. Lots of internal competition and not many chances to grow.
pros: The company is growing well in the last years and it has money. You will have all what you need to work here, in terms of software, cad, licenses, computer farms, lab equipment.  If you're able to mentor yourself, you will benefit from that, even if often means that you have to invest extra working hours for your growth.
cons:
If your company is not treating you equally to your colleagues, you will have a hard time getting over the bad mood for not being recognized and, in a town like Villach, this will influence a lot your motivation to stay. 

I have experienced that several times, from the hiring procedure, the promotions and salary level, the patenting of intellectual properties, the assignement to interesting projects, etc.. 
Managers and HRs are often trying to sell you lies, but it doesn't take much to discover it. 

I have seen colleagues with lower experience getting promoted to higher levels even not being able to do anything above the average complexity independently and in constant need of help.
I have seen people interested in my work only when there was a possibility of making an invention out of it, but not when I needed support for the design.
I have lost rights on my own inventions and I didn't get any compensation when I made that clear.

Being a large semiconductor company, it is more interested in making money out of a product without investing much in new researches; most of the researches are outsourced.
Therefore the designers are starving to get some innovation and they compete to get into the few new projects. Once you get one, it feels oppressive; they will make you feel like you have got priviledges, even if you worked hard for that.

Job is not hard and the salary level is ok, which means that people without many ambitions will stay there. The discrete engineers will stay while the most ambitious ones will leave. I have seen many great people leave in the years for the same reasons above and the company struggling to find replacements.

Villach is a nice town, but it's very hard to make a life there and get connections to other people.
